taskDescription:
Identify which of the following are rational numbers.
− 41 , 13 , 4 3 , 2.75 , 0.2 13 ¯ - 41,{\mkern 1mu} \,\sqrt {13,} {\mkern 1mu} \,\frac{4}{3},\,\,2.75,\,{\mkern 1mu} 0.2\overline {13}
detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>41</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mspace width="0.056em"></mspace>
  </mrow>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>4</mn>
    <mn>3</mn>
  </mfrac>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mn>2.75</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mspace width="0.056em"></mspace>
  </mrow>
  <mn>0.2</mn>
  <mover>
    <mn>13</mn>
    <mo accent="false">¯<!-- ¯ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">- 41,{\mkern 1mu} \,\frac{4}{3},\,\,2.75,\,{\mkern 1mu} 0.2\overline {13}</annotation></semantics></math> are rational; <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <msqrt>
    <mn>13</mn>
  </msqrt>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\sqrt {13}</annotation></semantics></math>   is not.
